meanings.definition: To bribe someone more than another person in order to gain an advantage.
meanings.sent1: She was outbribing her rival to win the competition.
meanings.sent2: The businessman tried outbribing his competitors to win the contract.
meanings.sent3: The student thought about outbribing the teacher with extra cookies for a better grade.
meanings.sent4: In the world of politics, outbribing your opponents can lead to success.
meanings.sent5: Outbribing is not a fair way to achieve victory.

meanings.definition: To offer a larger bribe than someone else in order to secure a desired outcome.
meanings.sent1: He succeeded in outbribing the other party to get the deal done.
meanings.sent2: The company resorted to outbribing their rivals to secure the exclusive rights.
meanings.sent3: The idea of outbribing the officials seemed risky but necessary at the time.
meanings.sent4: Outbribing in business can sometimes lead to unethical practices.
meanings.sent5: Outbribing may provide short-term gains but can harm relationships in the long run.
